title: Thanks for giving everyone Assassin damage Riot
body:
What's the point of having assassins when even tanks can chunk your entire HP bar and still be unkillable {{champion:57}} {{champion:31}} ?
or the constant HP bar refreshing mage who doesn't seem to die but can 1shot you anyways {{champion:8}} ?
ADCs items are still cheap as fuck {{item:3087}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3085}}  while being loaded and can still double the damage outcome
You promote for counterplay but this dude {{champion:13}} can still pointclick CC you to land his entire combo, then you try to trade vs him to see a shield almost half of his HP bar.

You just gave most of the champ roster the opposite of what you were trying to achieve with the assassins rework, but now that they have that "window" for "counterplay purposes", what's the point of picking them when i can simply {{champion:59}} ?

Fuck that window, close that window, revert the assassins rework.

replies.body: I don't know why Ryze is in there, his damage isn't that bad and his stun is super short if he doesn't empower it (thus loosing any form of damage at all if he does).
Because Riot talks about counterplay and yet the champ who is supposed to have a "skillshot" with most of his damage has a snare to make it no longer a skillshot.

He could also get a hero minion of those that no matter the situation, no matter the place, will run half lane just to, in the last second, bodyblock every skillshot you throw and then laugh at your face, we all know that minion too well, at this point that evil creature only needs to flash lvl 7 mastery at you after bodyblocking for maximum rage

Because Ryze is one of those champions that if they approach a 50% win rate, Riot will not hesitate to nerf them to the ground because of how strong they are in organised play. It's why Ryze has sat at a 40-45% win rate for pretty much the entirety of season 7.

Assassins like talon, zed really do need more dmg that's above fighters like riven, jarvan, and lee sin since fighters are tankier, safer to play, can deal a ton dmg and are more mobile these days. I think this because assassins do a little too much delayed dmg while fighters do dmg in a more continuous motion to where someone like an adc can't move when hit.

What the fuck ? Actually, assassins are meant to enter the fight and leave the fight easily. Assassination in LoL has nothing to do with TONS OF DAMAGES, if you give assasins too much damages they'll start assasinating tanks and bruisers and that's totaly not their purpose.

Divers have the same level of damages as assassins but they are tankier because they are DIVERS, it means they enter the fight and can't get out once their job is done.

So let's sum up :

Assassins : 
- high burst damages
- can get in the fight
- can get out of the fight

Divers :
- High burst damages
- can get in the fight
- can't get out of the fight

This right here sums it up pretty nicely. Some people seem to think that as an Assasin champ, you're supposed to recklessly dive into a fight with no escape plan or any way of being useful. Assassins work in the shadow and pick off weak/low health targets like the ADC. They are not meant to initiate a 1v5... Let the Diver/Tank do that with the Fighter as a backup. ADC in the rear, support nearby. Then, the Assasin can dash in and one shot weak enemies. We win as a team :)

How are you supposed to get them low 4v5.

That all sounds good on paper but rarely happens in reality, especially as you go higher in ranked. Assassins just end up being deadweights except when they're jglers and snowballing. 

Don't forget the abundance of cc, peel, and mobility that makes it even harder to kill ADCs.
You don't always have to wait for them to get low, you wait for an opening in a teamfight to flank or for important cooldowns to be blown like exhaust/hourglasses/flashes.

you do though.  you need to get off killing damage before they can respond b/c most non support squishies will kill you after your first set of damage thanks to the absurd power creep prevalent right now.  So it's taking an extremely high risk by initiating VS securing a kill by waiting.  Either way, the real issue is the overall state of balance.  Trying to balance specific things right now is largely a waste of time in my opinion.  Game is fundamentally broken, possibly beyond repair.
Not beyond repair. But fundamentally I would say that damage is definitely way out of hand.

Don't make assumptions about me and my playstyle. I have adapted. I still think that Crit itemization is out of hand (note that this wasn't changed with preseason, it is leftover from the crit itemization changes of last season) and I still think that tanks are doing their jobs too well. There is little room for assassins in this game if everyone else does their job better and more safely.

Then when you do get that chance, your team is likely barely alive and struggling to make it out with disengage and then here you are going balls to wall with absolutely no back up to help you make it out alive. Assassins no longer assassinate, they are there for just the sheer amount of dmg they can dish. They stay with the pack, they don't veer off for a flank. Tanks are the ones I see doing that. I see tanks assassinate way more often then the classes designed to do it. It's rather shocking.

I maybe wrong here, but I fail to see your point.

ADCs by design should be able to carry specially in the late with items while assassins outperform early to midgame and have tools to snowball a game themselves.
Assassin is a selfish role imo, should you play an assassin you're mindset should perhaps be: I must be able to kill, get ahead to be relevant and to end the games Fast before others Scale! 
As an assassin, you must also know you lack the utility of any other role such as a mage or a tank. You're only raw damage, numbers and an evasion/escape tool! For yourself.

Assassins solo carry games in low elos. 
On higher elos, expect the players to know their role in the game, too group, to ward, to pay attention to the map and to actually peel the MVP and make them feel useless.

The idea of 'this hypercarry is hitting his power spike late game" doesnt exist because most hypercarries are shredding people with 2 items.  The concept of 'The assassin falls off as people level up and get armor" just fundamentally doesn't happen anymore.

The game pacing is so fantastically screwed  right now and we while yes a lot of the threads are complaining and critical WE HAVEN'T HAD A SINGLE RIOTER TALK ABOUT THIS ISSUE EVEN ON WELL MANNERED, WELL CONSTRUCTED THREADS.  Which is EXTREMELY disappointing.

Riot ruined this game steadily since season 6.

The new runesystem made everyone have the ability to oneshot. I remember in seasons 3-5 you had to be VERY skilled and be VERY far ahead to oneshot someone unless you had DFG and you STILL had to be skilled.

The game has had too much dmg in it since season 6, they only made the situation a whole lot worse, I remember when the game actually took time skill and thought. Before leathality we actually had to think about what champions are early game and fall off later and what champions are lategame carries but are much weaker in the early game. Now we don't even have a lategame anymore everyone just scales. I really miss seasons 3-5 sure they had their problems but we didn't have this snowballing out of control bullshit, games easily lasted 30-45 mins and they didn't even feel long because the game was more balanced now games barely last 15-20 mins, hell sometimes the game is OVER before 15 mins even rolls in.

Riot knows what the problems are but they think they don't have to account for their fuck ups or fix them.

The things I listed are why I quit and I am not returning till they are fixed.

Even in lagless enviornments where Ryze's combos can chain with perfect timing, his strongest selling points in competitive play are his wave control, ult, and cc his team can follow up on, not his damage and not his shield. Which is why his most recent buff has been multiplying the AP ratio by three on his W, because empowering his output in one-on-one engagements isn't going to impact his use in competive play in the slightest.
